title: APC Demands Probe As State Govt Denies Involvement • Channels Television
content: A front view of the APC secretariat in Ado-Ekiti, Ekiti State.  The All Progressives Congress (APC) in Ekiti State has called for an investigation into the shooting that occurred during a rally at its secretariat in Ado-Ekiti.    A former member of the House of Representatives, Opeyemi Bamidele, and another member of the APC were injured on Friday in the incident which was assumed to be an accidental discharge by a police officer.    READ ALSO : Fayemi Was Target Of Shooting, Says Ekiti APC Chairman    The flag-off rally was supposed to signal the beginning of the campaign of the APC governorship candidate, Dr Kayode Fayemi, ahead of the July 14 election, before it turned sour.    The police had disclosed that the officer who fired the shot was on an illegal duty and had already been apprehended and detained.    The APC Chairman in the state, Mr Jide Awe, however, insisted that there was more to the shooting rather than the opinion of accidental discharge held in some quarters.    He questioned why…     Read More….. Channels TV News
